message.content: This question requires knowledge about the formation of the Great Lakes. The Great Lakes were formed by the erosion of glaciers during the last Ice Age. As the glaciers moved, they carved out deep depressions in the Earth's surface, which eventually filled with meltwater, forming the Great Lakes. Option (A) is incorrect because visitors have no impact on the formation of the Great Lakes. Option (C) is unrelated and not based on any scientific evidence.
